New Records: Herro set a franchise record with 70 straight games with at least one 3-pointer, breaking teammate Duncan Robinson's mark of 69 games ending in 2021.
Key Match Events: Jaquez had 20, including five in the final 1:03

The Jazz had cut the lead to 90-88 and won a coaches challenge on a foul call on Walker Kessler, but the Heat won the resulting jump ball and Jaquez made a 3-pointer with 1:03 to play to give them the cushion they needed down the stretch
Pre-Game Insights: The Heat played without Kevin Love (personal reasons)
Jimmy Butler was suspended for seven games
The Jazz were missing six injured players, including Jordan Clarkson (foot), John Collins (hip), Keyonte George (heel) and Brice Sensabaugh
Others: The Jazz had 17 turnovers â€” many unforced
The Heat made the most of transition points (17-7) and hustle plays when it mattered
The Heat improved each game since Butler's suspension, losing in two overtimes to Sacramento before winning against Golden State and Utah
